Context:
* In 2023, George Brown College received a Mitacs Accelerate Umbrella Award worth $4.5 million, supporting 300 paid student research internships over two years.
* George Brown College ranked among the top 10 Canadian research colleges for 2022.
* In January 2023, VP Academic Eileen De Courcy signed agreements in Ireland to expand international opportunities with DÃºn Laoghaire Institute of Art, Design and Technology (IADT) and South East Technological University (SETU).
* In April 2023, students, employees, and faculty at the Centre for Hospitality and Culinary Arts cooked 20,000 meals in three days to support Solidarity Kitchen, delivering thousands of portions of pork parmentier to Second Harvest.
* George Brown College launched the Brookfield Sustainability Institute (BSI) in May 2023.
* BSI is a first-of-its-kind Ontario college-based centre of excellence for tackling challenges posed by climate change, partnering with businesses, governments, not-for-profit organizations, and other institutions to create tangible solutions for building sustainable communities.
* Some partners and guests at the BSI launch included EllisDon President and CEO Geoff Smith, Mattamy Asset Management Inc. Chairman and CEO Peter Gilgan, RBC CEO Dave McKay, and EllisDon Chief Strategy Officer and EVP, Infrastructure Services and Technology Jody Becker.

Context:
* GBC students won medals at Skills Ontario competition in 2023.
* Chloe Nguyen won gold in Baking category.
* Negus King won gold in Culinary Arts category.
* Karla Alejandra Estrada Santiago won gold in Restaurant Services category.
* Darryl Hu won silver in Baking category.
* Brad Slaney won bronze in Sheet Metal category.
* Construction of Limberlost Place completed, opening to students in January 2025.
* GBC hosted town hall event with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Barbadian Prime Minister Mia Mottley in August 2023.
* Discussion topics included Canadian-Caribbean relations and building a healthier and more prosperous world.
* Our City is Our Classroom marketing campaign launched on October 30, 2023.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/The highlights of 2023 at George Brown College | George Brown College.txt

Context: The text mentions that 50 students, faculty, and staff were involved in the college's Housing Task Force. The task force was formed in February 2023. The college has made it onto Greater Toronto's Top Employers list for the eighth consecutive year. In late 2023, the college announced a joint acquisition of Corus Quay (located at 25 Dockside Drive) to expand and provide more modern learning spaces. Contact information includes phone number 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and email ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college's social media hub is also mentioned.
